neighbor_tools.h

1 #ifndef VOXBLOX_UTILS_NEIGHBOR_TOOLS_H_
2 #define VOXBLOX_UTILS_NEIGHBOR_TOOLS_H_
3 
4 #include "voxblox/core/common.h"
5 #include "voxblox/core/layer.h"
6 
7 namespace voxblox {
8 
9 // Define what connectivity you want to have in the voxels.
10 enum Connectivity : unsigned int {
11  kSix = 6u,
12  kEighteen = 18u,
13  kTwentySix = 26u
14 };
15 
16 class NeighborhoodLookupTables {
17  public:
18  typedef Eigen::Matrix<LongIndexElement, 3, Connectivity::kTwentySix>
19  LongIndexOffsets;
20  typedef Eigen::Matrix<IndexElement, 3, Connectivity::kTwentySix> IndexOffsets;
21  typedef Eigen::Matrix<float, 1, Connectivity::kTwentySix> Distances;
22 
23  // Stores the distances to the 6, 18, and 26 neighborhood, in that order.
24  // These distances need to be scaled by the voxel distance to get metric
25  // distances.
26  static const Distances kDistances;
27 
28  // Lookup table for the offsets between a index and its 6, 18, and 26
29  // neighborhood, in that order. These two offset tables are the same except
30  // for the type, this saves casting the offset when used with either global
31  // index (long) or local index (int) in the neighborhood lookup.
32  static const IndexOffsets kOffsets;
33  static const LongIndexOffsets kLongOffsets;
34 };
35 
36 template <Connectivity kConnectivity = Connectivity::kTwentySix>
37 class Neighborhood : public NeighborhoodLookupTables {
38  public:
39  typedef Eigen::Matrix<LongIndexElement, 3, kConnectivity> IndexMatrix;
40 
41  // Get the global index of all (6, 18, or 26) neighbors of the input index.
42  static void getFromGlobalIndex(const GlobalIndex& global_index,
43  IndexMatrix* neighbors) {
44  CHECK_NOTNULL(neighbors);
45  for (unsigned int i = 0u; i < kConnectivity; ++i) {
46  neighbors->col(i) = global_index + kLongOffsets.col(i);
47  }
48  }
49 
50  // Get the block idx and local voxel index of a neighbor voxel. The neighbor
51  // voxel is defined by providing a direction. The main purpose of this
52  // function is to solve the cross-block indexing that happens when looking up
53  // neighbors at the block boundaries.
54  static void getFromBlockAndVoxelIndexAndDirection(
55  const BlockIndex& block_index, const VoxelIndex& voxel_index,
56  const SignedIndex& direction, const size_t voxels_per_side,
57  BlockIndex* neighbor_block_index, VoxelIndex* neighbor_voxel_index) {
58  CHECK_GT(voxels_per_side, 0u);
59  CHECK_NOTNULL(neighbor_block_index);
60  CHECK_NOTNULL(neighbor_voxel_index);
61 
62  *neighbor_block_index = block_index;
63  *neighbor_voxel_index = voxel_index + direction;
64 
65  for (unsigned int i = 0u; i < 3u; ++i) {
66  while ((*neighbor_voxel_index)(i) < 0) {
67  (*neighbor_block_index)(i)--;
68  (*neighbor_voxel_index)(i) += voxels_per_side;
69  }
70  while ((*neighbor_voxel_index)(i) >=
71  static_cast<IndexElement>(voxels_per_side)) {
72  (*neighbor_block_index)(i)++;
73  (*neighbor_voxel_index)(i) -= voxels_per_side;
74  }
75  }
76  }
77 
78  // Get the hierarchical indices (block idx, local voxel index) for all
79  // neighbors (6, 18, or 26 neighborhood) of a hierarcical index. This function
80  // solves the cross-block indexing that happens when looking up neighbors at
81  // the block boundary.
82  static void getFromBlockAndVoxelIndex(
83  const BlockIndex& block_index, const VoxelIndex& voxel_index,
84  const size_t voxels_per_side, AlignedVector<VoxelKey>* neighbors_ptr) {
85  CHECK_NOTNULL(neighbors_ptr)->resize(kConnectivity);
86 
87  AlignedVector<VoxelKey>& neighbors = *neighbors_ptr;
88  for (unsigned int i = 0u; i < kConnectivity; ++i) {
89  VoxelKey& neighbor = neighbors[i];
90  getFromBlockAndVoxelIndexAndDirection(block_index, voxel_index,
91  kOffsets.col(i), voxels_per_side,
92  &neighbor.first, &neighbor.second);
93  }
94  }
95 
96  // Get the signed offset between the global indices of two voxels.
97  static SignedIndex getOffsetBetweenVoxels(const BlockIndex& start_block_index,
98  const VoxelIndex& start_voxel_index,
99  const BlockIndex& end_block_index,
100  const VoxelIndex& end_voxel_index,
101  const size_t voxels_per_side) {
102  CHECK_NE(voxels_per_side, 0u);
103  return (end_voxel_index - start_voxel_index) +
104  (end_block_index - start_block_index) * voxels_per_side;
105  }
106 };
107 } // namespace voxblox
108
